strategy: Replace the gradient-boosting model with a neural network architecture using a shallow multi-layer perceptron (MLP). Instead of feature engineering focused on categorical interactions, apply automatic feature selection via mutual information scoring to identify the most predictive features from raw inputs (e.g., age, fare, number of siblings/spouses, cabin letters). Normalize all continuous features using z-score normalization and introduce a dropout layer to prevent overfitting. Train using early stopping on validation accuracy with a balanced dataset split. This approach leverages non-linear patterns in continuous and mixed data without relying on handcrafted interaction terms.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectKBest, f_classif
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Extract features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Select only relevant features for neural network
features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
X = X[features]
test_df = test_df[features]

# Feature selection using mutual information
selector = SelectKBest(f_classif, k=5)
X_selected = selector.fit_transform(X, y)
X_selected_df = pd.DataFrame(X_selected, columns=features)

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_selected_df)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Define and train neural network
mlp = MLPClassifier(
    hidden_layer_sizes=(64, 32),
    activation='relu',
    solver='adam',
    max_iter=500,
    random_state=42,
    early_stopping=True,
    validation_fraction=0.2,
    tol=1e-4,
    dropout=0.3
)

# Train model
mlp.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = mlp.p

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectKBest, f_classif
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Extract features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Select only relevant features for neural network
features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Sex', 'Embarked']

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
X = X[features]
test_df = test_df[features]

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Train neural network
mlp = MLPClassifier(
    hidden_layer_sizes=(64, 32),
    activation='relu',
    solver='adam',
    max_iter=500,
    random_state=42,
    early_stopping=True,
    validation_fraction=0.2,
    tol=1e-4
)

mlp.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = mlp.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
X = X[features]
test_df = test_df[features]

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Train neural network
mlp = MLPClassifier(
    hidden_layer_sizes=(64, 32),
    activation='relu',
    solver='adam',
    max_iter=500,
    random_state=42,
    early_stopping=True,
    validation_fraction=0.2,
    tol=1e-4
)

mlp.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = mlp.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPClassifier

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Sex', 'Embarked']
X = X[features]
test_df = test_df[features]

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Train neural network
mlp = MLPClassifier(
    hidden_layer_sizes=(64, 32),
    activation='relu',
    solver='adam',
    max_iter=500,
    random_state=42,
    early_stopping=True,
    validation_fraction=0.2,
    tol=1e-4
)

mlp.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = mlp.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
